body_html:
Let's keep it as is for now.

On Mon, Nov 14, 2016 at 9:06 AM, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

@alrojo commented on this pull request.

In tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/kernel_tests/seq2seq_test.py
#4686:

  •        [decoder_outputs_train, decoder_state_train])

  •    decoder_outputs_inference_res, decoder_state_inference_res = sess.run(

  •        [decoder_outputs_inference, decoder_state_inference])

  •    # Assert outputs

  •    self.assertEqual((decoder_sequence_length, batch_size, output_size),

  •                     decoder_outputs_train_res.shape)

  •    self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),

  •                     decoder_outputs_inference_res.shape[0:2])

  •    self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),

  •                     decoder_state_train_res.shape)

  •    self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),

  •                     decoder_state_inference_res.shape)

  •    # The dynamic decoder might end earlier than `maximal_length`

  •    # under inference

  •    true_value = (decoder_sequence_length>=

@ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo would you like to keep kernel_tests
as is, or modify dynamic_rnn_decoder to also return the sequence_lengths
in order to support value assertion? (as elaborated above)
Thanks

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#4686, or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2d7TV0hovsRCRLQkSftxFydiKl6ks5q-JUCgaJpZM4KLMiD
.
body_text:
Let's keep it as is for now.
On Mon, Nov 14, 2016 at 9:06 AM, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

@alrojo commented on this pull request.
In tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/kernel_tests/seq2seq_test.py
#4686:



       [decoder_outputs_train, decoder_state_train])



   decoder_outputs_inference_res, decoder_state_inference_res = sess.run(



       [decoder_outputs_inference, decoder_state_inference])






   # Assert outputs



   self.assertEqual((decoder_sequence_length, batch_size, output_size),



                    decoder_outputs_train_res.shape)



   self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),



                    decoder_outputs_inference_res.shape[0:2])



   self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),



                    decoder_state_train_res.shape)



   self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),



                    decoder_state_inference_res.shape)



   # The dynamic decoder might end earlier than `maximal_length`



   # under inference



   true_value = (decoder_sequence_length>=




@ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo would you like to keep kernel_tests
as is, or modify dynamic_rnn_decoder to also return the sequence_lengths
in order to support value assertion? (as elaborated above)
Thanks
—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

#4686, or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim2d7TV0hovsRCRLQkSftxFydiKl6ks5q-JUCgaJpZM4KLMiD
.
body:
Let's keep it as is for now.

On Mon, Nov 14, 2016 at 9:06 AM, Alexander Rosenberg Johansen <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> ## _@alrojo_ commented on this pull request.
> 
> In tensorflow/contrib/seq2seq/python/kernel_tests/seq2seq_test.py
> https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/4686:
> 
> > -            [decoder_outputs_train, decoder_state_train])
> > -        decoder_outputs_inference_res, decoder_state_inference_res = sess.run(
> > -            [decoder_outputs_inference, decoder_state_inference])
> >   +
> > -        # Assert outputs
> > -        self.assertEqual((decoder_sequence_length, batch_size, output_size),
> > -                         decoder_outputs_train_res.shape)
> > -        self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),
> > -                         decoder_outputs_inference_res.shape[0:2])
> > -        self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),
> > -                         decoder_state_train_res.shape)
> > -        self.assertEqual((batch_size, decoder_size),
> > -                         decoder_state_inference_res.shape)
> > -        # The dynamic decoder might end earlier than `maximal_length`
> > -        # under inference
> > -        true_value = (decoder_sequence_length>=
> 
> @ebrevdo https://github.com/ebrevdo would you like to keep kernel_tests
> as is, or modify dynamic_rnn_decoder to also return the sequence_lengths
> in order to support value assertion? (as elaborated above)
> Thanks
>
